title: TommyPop
description: Use this game to distract a child without exposing them to addictive games or inappropriate content. TommyPop is designed to be interesting for a minute or two before becoming boring.

sections.content: A minimalist bubble-popping game designed specifically for toddlers. No high-dopamine rewards. No hidden agendas. A natural exit built in.

content: No High-Dopamine Rewards: No flashing lights, “level up” sounds, or loot boxes.
No Hidden Agendas: Zero advertisements, zero in-app purchases, and no age-inappropriate content.
A Natural Exit: The game is fun enough to engage a child’s curiosity but predictable enough that they will eventually choose to put it down.

content.title: The “Low-Friction” Swap
content.text: While the child is using the addictive device, load TommyPop on a separate phone. Offer it as a swap.

content.title: The Attention Shift
content.text: The repetitive nature of the game lowers their neurological intensity. Watch for signs of boredom or looking around the room.

content.title: The Montessori Catch
content.text: Before the child becomes frustrated, “catch” their broadening attention with a prepared physical activity.

content.title: Hide the Tech
content.text: Once the child engages with the physical toy, quietly remove and hide all phone devices.

content.title: Anchor with Routine
content.text: Time the end of the physical activity with a meal. This provides a natural biological transition.

sections.content: By moving from Narrow (Addictive games) to Open (Reading/Board games), you train your child’s brain to find satisfaction in slower-paced, developmental activities.
